results.title: Drawings and the shop
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Engineering Drawing”.
Emphasises and describes the relationship between the making of the drawing and the various production operations in shop and factory. The flow of work, as called for in the various drawings of typical metal products, is traced through the pattern shop, the foundry, the forge shop, the machine shop, and the assembly shop. Representative operations in each of these departments is demonstrated.

results.title: Drawing with a pencil
results.brief_description: The technique of one of America’s foremost pencil sketchers, Thomas Kautsky, is shown by observing him at work sketching a 17th century cooper’s shop situated between the towns of Rockport and Gloucester, in Massachussetts, USA. The film is designed for use by teachers of art, and will be most useful if previewed by the teacher before use with a class.

results.title: Drama lesson
results.creator_credit: Joe Scully, Richard Mason and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Provides an insight into the system of ‘creative drama’ being practiced in some Australian schools. The system aims to stimulate the imagination of the children. Encourages children to improvise and recreate situations based on their experiences. Includes a film made by an improvisation and discusses the planning of its action. Drama teacher Jean Stuart and students from Fort Street Girls High School and Vaucluse Boy’s Hight School appear in this documentary.

results.title: Drama is...
results.creator_credit: Rob McCubbin and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: To promote drama as a method which teachers should have in their armoury of skills. It shows how drama can be integrated into the total curriculum, and how it can be about coming to grips with real problems and about caring, sharing and understanding.

results.title: Il Drama di Cristo
results.creator_credit: Enrico Gras, Luciano Emmer and Colonna Film
results.brief_description: A study of the frescoes of Giotto (1267-1337) in the Sorovegni Chapel, Padua, of four of the most human and dramatic episodes in the life of Christ: the Nativity, the Massacre of the Innocents, Judas’ betrayal and the Crucifixion.

results.title: Dr Robert Simpson
results.creator_credit: Kenneth Vose, Harold Mayer and United States Information Agency
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “One Man”.
Dr Robert Simpson is the director of the National Hurricane Watch Centre at the University of Miami. He discusse his responsibility for tracking hurricanes which originate in the south east Atlantic and for warning the public along the Eastern Atlantic Coast on the intensity and course which the hurricanes will takes. Narrated by Barry Sullivan. Written by Kenneth Vose.

results.title: Dr Jekyll and Mr Hyde. - [Edited version]
results.creator_credit: Saul J. Turell, Paul Killiam and Paul Killiam Film Classic
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of the Motion Picture”.
This 1920’s film with John Barrymore was the first great American horror film. It was a tour-de-force for Barrymore, and a classic of macabre film making. This edited work retains all the ingredients for which it is famous. The narration points out its significance in motion picture history and provides interesting comment on the craftsmen who made it.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Saul J. Turell, Paul Killiam and Paul Killiam Film Classic
